enbyfit package¶

Submodules¶

enbyfit.body module¶

Defines a Body object for the Person’s object in fitpy. Person and Body are defined independently, but can be defined together. Both objects can also be added and/or use the objects defined in sports.py .

class enbyfit.body.Body(age, height, weight, hormonal_sex=None, waist=None, hip=None)¶

Bases: object

Body Class.

Parameters

  • age (int, protected) – Age of the Person in years

  • height (float, protected) – Height of the Person in cm

  • weight (float, protected) – Weight of the Person in kg

  • hormonal_sex (string, protected) – Hormonal Sex of the Person

  • waist (float, protected) – Waist size of the Person in cm

  • hip (float, protected) – Hip size of the Person in cm

property bmi¶

Get the BMI.

The bmi is calculated with the weight in kg divided by the square ofthe height in meters; In general the Ponderal Index is more expressive.

Returns

Returns the Body-Mass-Index

Return type

float

Example
>>> Body(22, 120, 80).bmi
55.6
property broca_index¶

Get Broca Index

Returns

Returns the Broca Index

Return type

float

property harris_benedict_equation¶

Get the BMR based on the Harris-Benedict equation

Hormonal Female:
BMR = 655 + (9.6 X weight in kilos)

  • (1.8 X height in cm) – (4.7 x age in years)

Hormonal Male:
BMR = 66 + (13.7 x weight in kilos)

  • (5 x height in cm) – (6.8 x age in years)

Returns

Returns the Daily calory need

Return type

int

if obj._hormonal_sex is not defined:
raise

AttributeError

property max_heartrate_moderate¶
Age predicted Maximum

Heart Rate

(BPM)

Returns

The max Heart Rate

Return type

int

property metabolic_rate¶

Get the Basal Metabolic Rate

The basal metabolic rate is calculated with the weight * 24 (hours); It is not really expressive, as it is igonring body facts which have influence on this, like muscle mass. It is recommended to use the Harris- Benedict Formula instead.

Returns

Returns the Metabolic Rate

Return type

int

Example
>>> Body(22, 180, 50).metabolic_rate
1200
property ponderal_index¶

Get the Ponderal Index

The ponderal index is calculated by the weight in kg divided by the height in meters to the power of three.

-> Results between 11 and 14 are interpreted as normal.

Returns

Returns the Ponderal Index

Return type

float

property waist2hip_ratio¶

Get the Waist-to-Hip Ratio

Returns

Returns the W-H-Ratio

Return type

enbyfit.person module¶

Defines a Person object.

class enbyfit.person.Person(name)¶

Bases: object

Person class.

The Person class is representing an User and related objects like Body, Sport, etc.

Parameters

  • name (string) – Name of the Person

  • obj_names (string) – Name of the object given

  • obj (class) – Objects passed

enbyfit.sports module¶

Containing different sports and activity classes which provide modules. Most classes need the body object as specific attributes are often needed, they are set as optional parameters as some modules or attributes can be used without specific attr. More help is provided in each class.

class enbyfit.sports.Running(body=None, km_run=0.0, time_sport=0)¶

Bases: object

Running class

Parameters

  • body (class: Body, optional, private) – Instance of an object which has needed parameters

  • km_run (float, optional, protected) – The distance which was run in km

  • time_sport (int, optional , protected) – The duration of the activity in minutes
